headline: Medtronic diabetes unit MiniMed seeks $784 million in US IPO
summary: The Northridge, California-based firm plans to market 28 million shares for $25 to $28 each, according to its filing Tuesday with the US Securities and Exchange Commission.  The IPO is expected to price March 5, an investor presentation shows.  At the top end of the price range, MiniMed would have a market value of about $7.86 billion, based on the outstanding shares listed in the filing.

headline: MiniMed announces launch of IPO roadshow
summary: MiniMed Group, Inc. (MiniMed), a subsidiary of Medtronic plc (Medtronic) (NYSE: MDT), today announced that it has launched a roadshow for the initial public offering (IPO) of 28,000,000 shares of its common stock. The proposed offering is part of Medtronic's previously announced plan to separate its Diabetes business into an independent public company.

headline: Trump's State of the Union: What business leaders want to hear
summary: President Trump is scheduled to give his State of the Union address on Tuesday night after threatening to impose new 15% global tariffs in response to the US Supreme Court's striking down his sweeping trade tariff policies. Harvard University executive education fellow Bill George speaks with Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi about what business leaders will want to hear from Trump in his speech tonight. George is also the former CEO of Medtronic (MDT). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.
